caption.p: Assessment of study participants (pharmacists and students) awareness about coronavirus pandemic (n = 726).

tr.td: One way of transmission of coronavirus is respiratory droplets from person to person among close contacts.
Coronavirus can be transmitted after touching surfaces that were contaminated with the virus.
Non-steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs such as Ibuprofen can decrease the risk of complications when used during viral infections.
Fever/dry cough/shortness of breath are associated with coronavirus.
Muscle aches and gastrointestinal symptoms (nausea/vomiting/diarrhea) are not associated with coronavirus.
Hand washing with soap and water for 20 s is enough to clean the hands and protect from spreading the infection.
Using steroids do not increase vulnerability to coronavirus infection.
Generally, the use of autoimmune disease treatments increase the susceptibility to contract coronavirus infection.
Hydroxychloroquine has not been used as a preventative therapy against coronavirus infection.
Azithromycin has been used along with hydroxychloroquine in the treatment of the coronavirus infection cases.
Oseltamivir has not been used in the management of coronavirus infection cases.
Protein calorie malnutrition impairs host immunity (particularly the T-cell system) resulting in increased opportunistic infections.
Patients should eat food that contains Vitamin C and D to boost their immunity.
Eating food like mushrooms and garlic is beneficial for the immune system.
Exercise causes antibodies and white blood cells to circulate in the body more rapidly detecting infections at an early stage.
The brief rise in body temperature during and right after exercise increases bacterial growth, which will lower the body's ability to fight the infection.
Not smoking and decreasing stress help support the immune system.
Sunlight activates T-helper cells hence boosts immunity.
You need to keep a distance of at least 3 m (10 feet) when counseling patients during a pandemic.
The highest risk patients in contracting coronavirus are elderly (>65), immune-compromised and children under the age of 9.

fn.p: Using Chi-square test, * significant at 0.05 significance level.
